intro: Brachypeza uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower brachypeza, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
